title: >-
  DAISY: A Data Information System for accountability
  under the General Data Protection Regulation

  Please use the citation when referencing our work in any published materials.

  type: article
  authors:

      given-names: Regina
      orcid: 'https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6711-8375'
    - family-names: Alper

    - family-names: Rege

  doi: "10.1093/gigascience/giz140"
  journal: "GigaScience"
  title: "DAISY: A Data Information System for accountability under the General Data Protection Regulation"
  volume: 8
  issue: 12
  year: 2019
  month: 12
  issn: "2047-217X"
  url: "https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giz140"
  abstract: "The new European legislation on data protection, namely, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), has introduced comprehensive requirements for the documentation about the processing of personal data as well as informing the data subjects of its use. GDPR’s accountability principle requires institutions, projects, and data hubs to document their data processings and demonstrate compliance with the GDPR. In response to this requirement, we see the emergence of commercial data-mapping tools, and institutions creating GDPR data register with such tools. One shortcoming of this approach is the genericity of tools, and their process-based model not capturing the project-based, collaborative nature of data processing in biomedical research.We have developed a software tool to allow research institutions to comply with the GDPR accountability requirement and map the sometimes very complex data flows in biomedical research. By analysing the transparency and record-keeping obligations of each GDPR principle, we observe that our tool effectively meets the accountability requirement.The GDPR is bringing data protection to center stage in research data management, necessitating dedicated tools, personnel, and processes. Our tool, DAISY, is tailored specifically for biomedical research and can help institutions in tackling the documentation challenge brought about by the GDPR. DAISY is made available as a free and open source tool on Github. DAISY is actively being used at the Luxembourg Centre for Systems Biomedicine and the ELIXIR-Luxembourg data hub."

# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as
contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and
our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression,
level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal
appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment
include:

* Using welcoming and inclusive language
* Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
* Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
* Focusing on what is best for the community
* Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or
 advances
* Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic
 address, without explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
 professional setting

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable
behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or
reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions
that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or
permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate,
threatening, offensive, or harmful.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces
when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of
representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail
address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be
further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported by contacting the project team at info@elixir-luxembourg.org. All
complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that
is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is
obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good
faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other
members of the project's leadership.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage], version 1.4,
available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq

# Contribution

This guide outlines the process for contributing to this repository.

## GitHub Workflow

We follow a standard GitHub workflow for contributions:

1. Fork the repository [if needed]
2. Create a new branch
3. Make your changes
4. Submit a pull request

## Pull Requests

- All major contributions should be made through pull requests (PRs).
- Branch names should start with the issue number (e.g., `124-fancy-new-feature`).
- PRs can be opened as soon as the branch is created. Use draft PRs for work in progress.
- PR titles should include the issue number (e.g., "#98: Improve error handling").
- Include relevant implementation notes and any deviations from the original issue description in the PR description.
- If the changes impact the user interface, include screenshots in the PR description.
- Resolve any merge conflicts before requesting a review.

## Definition of "Done" (DoD)

Before marking a PR as ready for review, ensure:

- All issue requirements are implemented
- CI pipeline is passing
- Test coverage is maintained or improved
- Unit tests cover the new implementation (except for very minor changes)
- Documentation (including README) is updated if necessary
- New methods and classes have docstrings and type hints

## Code Review Process

- At least one approval from another team member is required before merging.
- Reviewers should check out the branch and test the feature, not just review the code.
- Use GitHub's review features for inline comments and general feedback.
- The PR author should address all comments and request re-review when ready.
- Reviewers should resolve comment threads once satisfied with the changes.
- After all threads are resolved and the PR is approved, it can be merged.

## After Merging

- Close the related issue once the PR is merged and the implementation has been verified in the test environment.
Data Information System (DAISY) is a data bookkeeping application designed to help Biomedical Research  institutions with their GDPR compliance.
Data Information System (DAISY) is a data bookkeeping application designed to help Biomedical Research institutions with their GDPR compliance.

DAISY comes with a **Docker deployment*. For more instructions see the deployment [guide](doc/deployment.md).

See also our

- [Backup manual](doc/backup.md) for creating and restoring backups.
- [Update manual](doc/update.md) for migration to newer version.
- [Management and administration manual](doc/administration.md) for regular maintenance tasks including starting/stopping the services, import/export of data, inspecting logs and clean up.
- [Development manual](doc/development.md) for steps to setup the development environment and guidance on how to contribute.

For legacy deployment (<1.8.1), please refer to the [Legacy deployment and administration manual](doc/legacy-deployment.md).

propagate that work, subject to this License.  You are not responsible

result.description:
# [v1.8.1](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/tree/v1.8.1)

## **Fixed bugs**
- Users can change OIDC ID of external contacts [\#508](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/508)
result.name: v1.8.1

result.description:
# [v1.8.0](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/tree/v1.8.0)

## **Remarks**

## **New features**

- Dataset Quick form is replaced by a Wizard form for enhanced user experience [\#433](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/433)
- New notification feature was added. Users are reminded about upcoming events directly in the interface or/and via email [\#470](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/470), [\#475](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/475)
- Entities can be imported directly from user interface. Import in JSON following [ELIXIR-LU schema](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/json-schemas) is supported. [\#438](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/438),
- Performance of access request creation endpoint is improved [\#443](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/443)
- Scientific metadata are now displayed and editable for dataset [\#439](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/439)
- REMS form name is displayed in list of exposures in dataset view and admin view [\#420](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/420)
- Code formatter Black was added to CI [\#446](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/446), [\#383](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/383)

## **Fixed bugs**

- Project don't get ELU\_ACCESSION id when dataset are published [\#456](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/456)
- Modifications of Use Restrictions are not saved. [\#436](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/436)
- Upon access approval in REMS, DAISY creates 4 access objects for given user [\#431](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/431)
- Special subject field in data declaration shows wrong value [\#408](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/408)
- Export to XLSX button is visible only to superadmin but this role have insufficient permissions [\#448](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/448)
- Upon access approval in REMS, DAISY creates 4 access objects for given user [\#431](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/431)
- Use restriction codes are not in standard format [\#462](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/462)
result.name: v1.8.0

result.description:
## **BREAKING CHANGE**

All published datasets (exposed via API) are unpublished during migration. A new exposure endpoint needs to be created by *administrator* with the name and API key and datasets must be exposed manualy by a user belonging to *datasteward* group.

## **New features**

- Support for multiple publishing endpoints [\#412](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/412).
    - Dataset metadata can be exposed to multiple pre-defined endpoints while using different external access request forms (e.g. [REMS](https://github.com/CSCfi/rems)).
    - New "endpoint" model keeps API key specific to each endpoint (e.g. data catalog, dashboard app, ...).

## **Fixed bugs**

- Cannot create access object [\#403](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/403)
result.name: v1.7.12

result.description:
# Changelog

## [1.7.11](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/tree/HEAD)

### **New Features**

- minor permission system fix
    - users with EDIT permission can create Access object
    - if an Access object has status "active", it can be edited only by member of daisy-datasteward group

### **Fixed bugs:**

- regular user cannot create access object ([403](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/403))
result.name: v1.7.11

result.description:
# Changelog

## [1.7.1](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/tree/HEAD)


### **BREAKING CHANGE**

- update to 1.7.1 requires manual changes in settings.py file for Keycloak integration. See this [section](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/blob/master/DEPLOYMENT.md#migration) for more details.

### **New Features**

- permission system ([#397](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/397))
    - technical refactoring and test coverage 
    - all user permissions are listed on user page
    - display inherited permissions on Dataset permission page
- only data stewards are able to change status of Access object
- bump the python-keycloak version to 2.6.0 and introduce the possibility to have different REALM to retrieve users and for login ([#396](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/396/))

### **Fixed bugs:**

- user uploading document cannot download the document ([276](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/276))
result.name: v1.7.1

result.description:
# Changelog

## [1.7.0](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/tree/HEAD)

### **BREAKING CHANGE**

- update to 1.7.0 requires changes Celery config file due to Celery migration to 5.X. See this [section](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/blob/master/DEPLOYMENT.md#migration) for more details.
- support of Python 3.6 was deprecated. Daisy now supports Python 3.9 [\#362](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/362)

### **New Features**

- Migration to Python 3.9 [\#363](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/363)
- History of Access entity is recorded in audit log [\#369](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/369)
- More attributes are displayed for Data Declaration, Document and Contact [\#354](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/354), [\#336](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/336), [\#355](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/355)
- Allow attaching arbitrary (scientific) metadata to DAISY entities [\#294](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/294)
- Access object can be created programmatically via API [\#349](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/349)
- Users can be synchronized from Keycloak database [\#280](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/280), [\#301](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/301)
- API supports export of Contract entities [\#310](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/310)
- Option to set branding label and color [\#286](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/286)
- Exporter has option to export also unpublished records [\#258](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/258)
- Small improvements for managing users in django-admin [\#333](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/333), [\#332](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/332)

### **Fixed bugs:**

- Auditors cannot upload/delete the document [\#357](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/357)
- Removed use restriction length limitation [\#347](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/347) , [\#340](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/340)
- Increase the number of possible use restrictions in the daisy Data Declarations. [\#307](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/307)
- Increase number of use restrictions in data declarations form [\#308](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/308)
- Fixes to importer/exporter [\#338](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/338), [\#325](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/325), [\#313](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/313), [\#316](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/316), [\#289](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/289)
- REMS API includes an error message [\#277](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/277)
- `Edit Document` icon does not react on Project page [\#337](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/337)
- Minor UI fixes [\#335](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/335),  [\#304](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/304), [\#303](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/303),  [\#305](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/305),[\#292](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/292)
- Used ontologies are now referenced [\#366](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/366)
result.name: v1.7.0

result.description:
**New Features:**

- User model now contains API key [\#237](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/237)
- Add support to link external identifier service [\#227](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/227) [\#206](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/206)
- Resource Entitlement Management System[REMS](https://github.com/CSCfi/rems) can be integrated to automatically log access in data logbook  [\#226](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/226)
- Publishing Dataset also publishes related Project and Partner entities [\#228](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/228)
- Dataset export contains all related Data Declaration details [\#194](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/194)
- End of Data processing events are logged in data logbook [\#45](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/45)
- [JSON schemas](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/json-schemas) used by importer are stored locally and their version is tracked [\#254](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/254)
- Entities can be published immediately after import using `--publish-on-import` flag [\#244](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/244)
- Import of an existing entity can by skipped usin `--skip-on-exist` flag [\#282](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/282)
- Ethics status on cohorts is kept on Cohort entity, not Project [\#139](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/139)
- Participants of a contract can be updated [\#235](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/235)
- Home organization is not anymore assumed to participate in a contract by default [\#215](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/215)
- Enumeration labels were updated for "Use Restriction Rule" [\#230](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/230)
- DPIA document can be added as an attachment rather than a fixed \(URL\) attribute [\#217](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/217)
- Same Data Declaration title can be used under different datasets [\#207](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/207)
- Bump Django from 2.2.20 to 2.2.24
- Bump django-celery-beat from 1.4.0 to 2.2.0
- Bump django-celery-results from 1.0.4 to 2.0.1
- Bump celery from 4.3.0 to 4.4.7

**Fixed bugs:**

- Broken project view [\#266](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/266)
- Formatting is not preserved for project lay summary [\#234](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/234)
- Export to xlsx fails for projects and datasets [\#233](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/233)
- Accession number should be unique [\#142](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/142)
- Empty use restriction form on data declaration edit form is validated [\#270](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/270)
result.name: v1.6.0

result.description:
**New Features**
- Major update of JSON import and export feature to follow [Elixir JSON](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/json-schemas) schemas [\#198](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/198), [\#199](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/199), [\#203](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/203), [\#216](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/216), [\#195](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/195)
- Data declaration transfer entity was upgraded to more generic data Logbook [\#219](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/219)
- Company roles were removed from contract entity and a comment field was added [\#218](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/218), [\#215](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/215)
- Entities Project and Dataset were added to API endpoint [\#198](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/198)
- Bump django-debug-toolbar from 1.11 to 1.11.1 [\#214](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/214)
- Bump django from 2.2.10 to 2.2.20 [\#208](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/208) , [\#202](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/202), [\#180](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/180)

**Documentation:**

- Update of deployment instructions  [\#181](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/181), [\#179](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/179), [\#151](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/151)

**Bug Fixes:**

- Missing placeholders on login page [\#134](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/134), [\#213](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/213)
- 500 Internal Server Error when uploading attachment to contract [\#191](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/191)
- Field "Has special subjects?" is not recorded correctly [\#148](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/148)
- Sorting projects by start date returns "No results" [\#152](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/152)
- Datasets and projects api endpoints are not public [\#205](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/205)
- Error when building Solr schema [\#121](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/121)
- Update solr schema files for docker [\#201](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/201)
- Missing public decorator to new api views [\#209](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/pull/209)
result.name: v1.5.0

result.description:
# New features
* superuser can export records into Excel file #163
* new dashboard layout #170
* new demo data #169
 * added footer with logos of funding institutions #21
* visual improvements:
 * arrows inside calendar #95
 * larger modal boxes #161
 * more compact editor forms #136
 * icons used in dataset declaration's dynamic section #21
# Documentation
* Update of README file layout (#129) and including link to demo deployment #158 
* Updating link to documentation on About page #155
# Bug fixes
* API now exposes only published entities #143

# new features and enhancements

*  make document's notes an optional field #96
*  added project name to contract's string representation #103
*  improvements to string representation of project records #123
*  added all models to Django admin #102
*  improved the visuals of project information in contracts list
*  improvements to the search box #89
*  added version number to home page #60 

# bug fixes

*  fixed table overflow issue on dataset details page #97

# documentation

* upgraded Django from 2.2.8 to 2.2.10 
*  added dockerignore, splitted Dockerfile to enable layers caching #128
result.name: v1.3.0

result.description:
# new features and enhancements

* Upgraded to Django 2.2 #104 
* Ability to update the Project of Contracts #86
* Ability to export DAISY records in JSON format #44 


# bug fixes

* Error 500 when updating dataset  #93
* Linking project to dataset with data declaration without contract returns Server Error (500) #101

# documentation

* About page displaying deployment version and sample logins (for the case of demo deployments) #106
result.name: v1.2.0

result.description:
## new features and enhancements
- Allow editing the sources of a Data declaration post-creation [#20](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/20)
- Extend Data declarations to record Legal Basis [#19](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/19)
- Add Data Declaration selection to Share/Transfer definition [#14](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/14)
- Add ability to update Access definitions of a Dataset [#10](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/10)
- Add Data Declaration selection to Storage definition [#12](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/12)
- Display (if possible) all attributes of entities in the Summary Box [#23](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/23)
- Add titles to modal editor forms [#16](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/16)
- Add delete confirmation dialogs [#18](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/18)
- Improve tooltips [#5](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/5)
- Add delete function for unpublished entities [#2](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/2)
- Add ability to update Storage definitions of a Dataset [#9](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/9)
- Make Contract optional when creating a share/transfer over a Dataset [#7](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/7)
- Add ability to update Share/Transfer records of a Dataset [#11](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/11)
- Move edit button to summary block area on Partner and Cohort pages [#22](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/22)
- Add Data declaration selection to Access definition [#13](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/13)
- Add country code to Partners [#27](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/27)
- Display Entity type in page title [#24](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/24)

## bug fixes
-  solr indexation of datadeclarations fails [#56](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/56)

## documentation
- Add documentation on how to protect the */solr endpoint [#37](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/37)
- Document update Instructions (Docker and CentOS) [#47](https://github.com/elixir-luxembourg/daisy/issues/47)
- Daisy User Manual has been published [online](https://r3.pages.uni.lu/labCards/stable/external/daisy/)
result.name: v1.1.0

result.value: You are encouraged to try Daisy for yourself using our [DEMO deployment](https://daisy-demo.elixir-luxembourg.org/).
